analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bya rgod phung po'i ri la dge slong steng nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bya rgod phung po'i ri la dge slong steng nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling on Vulture Peak Mountain in Rājagṛha, together with a great saṅgha of 1,250 monks.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin rgyal po'i khab kyi dur khrod chen po bsil ba'i gnas na bud shing chen po lta bu'i phyogs na @441b 'dug go /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin rgyal po'i khab kyi dur khrod chen po bsil ba'i gnas na bud shing chen po lta bu'i phyogs na @441b 'dug go /
translated: At that time, the venerable Rāhula was sitting in the great charnel ground of Rājagṛha, in the Cool Grove, like a great log of firewood.

original: der 'di lta ste /
analyzed: der 'di lta ste /

original: lha'i gdon rnams dang / lha ma yin gyi gdon rnams dang / klu'i gdon rnams dang / gnod sbyin gyi gdon rnams dang / srin po'i gdon rnams dang / mi 'am ci'i gdon rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po'i gdon rnams dang / dri za'i gdon rnams dang /🔽mi'i gdon rnams dang / rlung lha'i gdon rnams dang / yi dvags kyi gdon rnams dang / 'byung po'i gdon rnams dang / sha za'i gdon rnams dang / grul bum gyi gdon rnams dang / gzig rnams dang / bya rog rnams dang / 'ug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: lha'i gdon rnams dang / lha ma yin gyi gdon rnams dang / klu'i gdon rnams dang / gnod sbyin gyi gdon rnams dang / srin po'i gdon rnams dang / mi 'am ci'i gdon rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po'i gdon rnams dang / dri za'i gdon rnams dang / mi'i gdon rnams dang / rlung lha'i gdon rnams dang / yi dvags kyi gdon rnams dang / 'byung po'i gdon rnams dang / sha za'i gdon rnams dang / grul bum gyi gdon rnams dang / gzig rnams dang / bya rog rnams dang / 'ug pa rnams dang /
translated: the gods, the asuras, the nāgas, the yakṣas, the rākṣasas, the kinnaras, the mahoragas, the gandharvas,🔽the humans, the wind gods, the pretas, the bhūtas, the piśācas, the kumbhāṇḍas, the leopards, the crows, the owls,

original: grog sbur rnams dang / sdig sbrul rnams dang / gzhan yang mi dang mi ma yin pa'i sems can rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la shin tu gtses so //
analyzed: grog sbur rnams dang / sdig sbrul rnams dang / gzhan yang mi dang mi ma yin pa'i sems can rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la shin tu gtses so //
translated: the ants, the snakes, and other human and nonhuman beings were all tormenting Venerable Rāhula.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin bya rgod phung po'i ri ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sbyan sngar dus te mchi ma blags so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin bya rgod phung po'i ri ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sbyan sngar dus te mchi ma blags so //
translated: Then Venerable Rāhula went to Vulture Peak Mountain, to where the Bhagavān was, and having arrived, he bowed his head at the Bhagavān’s feet, circumambulated the Bhagavān three times, and sat down in the Bhagavān’s presence, weeping.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la bka' stsal pa; sgra gcan zin /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la bka' stsal pa; sgra gcan zin /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to Venerable Rāhula, “Rāhula,

original: khyod ci'i phyir nga'i mdun na 'dug nas mchi ma blag /
analyzed: khyod ci'i phyir nga'i mdun na 'dug nas mchi ma blag /
translated: why are you sitting in front of me, weeping?”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin gyis 'di @442a *//🔽skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin gyis 'di @442a *// skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this was said, Venerable Rāhula said to the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bdag rgyal po'i khab kyi dur khrod chen po bsil ba'i gnas na bud shing chen po lta bu'i phyogs na mchis na /
analyzed: bdag rgyal po'i khab kyi dur khrod chen po bsil ba'i gnas na bud shing chen po lta bu'i phyogs na mchis na /

original: der lha'i gdon rnams dang / lha ma yin gyi gdon rnams dang / klu'i gdon rnams dang / gnod sbyin gyi gdon rnams dang / srin po'i gdon rnams dang / mi 'am ci'i gdon rnams dang / dri za'i gdon rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po'i gdon rnams dang /
analyzed: der lha'i gdon rnams dang / lha ma yin gyi gdon rnams dang / klu'i gdon rnams dang / gnod sbyin gyi gdon rnams dang / srin po'i gdon rnams dang / mi 'am ci'i gdon rnams dang / dri za'i gdon rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po'i gdon rnams dang /
translated: There are the grahas of the gods, the grahas of the asuras, the grahas of the nāgas, the grahas of the yakṣas, the grahas of the rākṣasas, the grahas of the kinnaras, the grahas of the gandharvas, the grahas of the mahoragas,

original: mi'i gdon rnams dang / rlung lha'i gdon rnams dang / yi dvags kyi gdon rnams dang / 'byung po'i gdon rnams dang / sha za'i gdon rnams dang / grul bum gyi gdon rnams dang / gzig rnams dang / bya rog rnams dang / 'ug pa rnams dang /

translated: the grahas of humans, the grahas of the wind gods, the grahas of the pretas, the grahas of the bhūtas, the grahas of the piśācas, the grahas of the kumbhāṇḍas, the grahas of the leopards, the grahas of the crows, the grahas of the owls,

original: grog sbur rnams dang / sdig sbrul rnams dang / gzhan yang mi dang mi ma yin pa'i sems can rnams kyis bdag la shin tu gtses lags mod /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin la bka' stsal pa /

translated: You should uphold this dhāraṇī mantra of the Great Stick for the protection, guarding, and safekeeping of the four retinues of monks, nuns, male lay followers, and female lay followers, and for their long-term benefit,

translated: King Brahmā, the Blessed Buddha, the Lord of the Dharma, the Dharma King, with unsurpassed love for the world, I beseech you to protect me.

original: su bskyang ba dang / zhi ba dang / bde legs su 'gyur ba dang / chad pa spang ba dang / mtshon cha spang pa dang / dug gsad pa dang / dug gzhil ba dang / mtshams gcad pa dang / sa bcing ba mdzad du gsol /

translated: Please fully protect, fully uphold, fully nurture, pacify, bring about well-being, stop punishments, stop weapons, destroy poisons, counteract poisons, set boundaries, and bind the ground.

translated: if you tie this dhāraṇī of the great staff, this hundred-and-ten-line knowledge mantra, on a thread and attach it to your arm

original: mgul du btags na /
analyzed: mgul du btags na /

original: kun nas dpag @443b tshad bcu khor yug tu be con rnams dang / me tog rnams dang / phyag rgya rnams kyis de srung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas dpag @443b tshad bcu khor yug tu be con rnams dang / me tog rnams dang / phyag rgya rnams kyis de srung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then staffs, flowers, and seals will surround you for ten yojanas in every direction and protect you.

original: de la mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams kyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams kyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: No humans or non-humans will be able to harm you.

original: mtshon dang / dug dang / nad dang / rims nad dang / rims drag po dang / rig sngags dang / gsang sngags dang / ro langs dang / khro gtum dang / me dang / chus 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon dang / dug dang / nad dang / rims nad dang / rims drag po dang / rig sngags dang / gsang sngags dang / ro langs dang / khro gtum dang / me dang / chus 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not die by weapons, poison, disease, epidemics, severe fevers, spells, mantras, zombies, wrath, fire, or water.

original: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags dang / sbyor ba rnams legs par sbyor ba thams cad kyi ma grub pa rnams grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags dang / sbyor ba rnams legs par sbyor ba thams cad kyi ma grub pa rnams grub par byed pa'o //
translated: They will accomplish all the rites of spells, mantras, and tantras that have not been accomplished.

original: grub pa rnams kyang chud mi za bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa rnams kyang chud mi za bar byed pa'o //
translated: They will not lose their accomplishments.

original: pha rol gyi sbyor ba 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sbyor ba 'ching ba'o //
translated: They will bind the spells of others.

original: pha rol gyis bcings pa las grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyis bcings pa las grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: They will free themselves from the bonds of others.

original: nad dang / mya ngan dang / bgegs rnam par 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nad dang / mya ngan dang / bgegs rnam par 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: They will destroy disease, sorrow, and obstacles.

original: 'thab pa'i rnyog pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa'i rnyog pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: They will pacify the turmoil of battle.

original: gdon thams cad zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gdon thams cad zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: They will avert all evil spirits.

original: gdon gang gis gtong ba de'i mgo aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du mgo tshal pa bdun du 'gas so; ;gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rje yang rdo rje 'bar pa /🔽kun tu 'bar ba /
analyzed: gdon gang gis gtong ba de'i mgo aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du mgo tshal pa bdun du 'gas so; ;gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rje yang rdo rje 'bar pa / kun tu 'bar ba /
translated: Even the great yakṣa general Vajrapāṇi will have his head split into seven pieces like the seed-pod of the Arjaka plant by a blazing vajra🔽that is completely engulfed in flames,

original: kun tu rab tu 'bar ba me lce gcig tu gyur pas /🔽de'i mgo aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du 'gas so //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'bar ba me lce gcig tu gyur pas / de'i mgo aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du 'gas so //

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi yang lcags kyi 'khor lo sbu gri'i so lta bu'i mtshon gyis phung bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi yang lcags kyi 'khor lo sbu gri'i so lta bu'i mtshon gyis phung bar byed do //
translated: The four great kings will destroy him with weapons that are like razors on a wheel of iron.

original: gnod sbyin gyi 'jig rten de nas shi @444a *//
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi 'jig rten de nas shi @444a *//
translated: When he dies and leaves the world of the yakṣas,

original: 'phos nas lcang lo can gyi pho brang 'khor du gnas pa mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'phos nas lcang lo can gyi pho brang 'khor du gnas pa mi 'thob bo //
translated: he will not be reborn in the palace of Aṭakā.

original: sgra gcan zin /
analyzed: sgra gcan zin /

original: rgyal po dang / mi rgod dang / me dang / chu dang / mtshon cha dang / 'brog dang / dgon pa dang / ri dang / mya ngam du song ba gang gis be con chen po'i gzungs kyi rig sngags 'di lan gcig brjod na /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / mi rgod dang / me dang / chu dang / mtshon cha dang / 'brog dang / dgon pa dang / ri dang / mya ngam du song ba gang gis be con chen po'i gzungs kyi rig sngags 'di lan gcig brjod na /
translated: If one who has gone to a king, a bandit, fire, water, a weapon, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, or a desolate place recites this Great Stick Dhāraṇī incantation once,

original: sdig pa thams cad las rab tu thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad las rab tu thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be completely liberated from all misdeeds.

original: sgra gcan zin /
analyzed: sgra gcan zin /

original: be con chen po'i gzungs kyi rig sngags 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang+g'a'i klung dgu bcu rtsa gcig gi bye ma snyed kyis gsungs pa; gsung ba /
analyzed: be con chen po'i gzungs kyi rig sngags 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang+g'a'i klung dgu bcu rtsa gcig gi bye ma snyed kyis gsungs pa; gsung ba /
translated: this Great Stick Dhāraṇī incantation has been taught by as many Blessed Buddhas as there are grains of sand in ninety-one Ganges Rivers,🔽is being taught,

original: gsung bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gsung bar 'gyur ba /

original: grub pa mchog tu gyur pa /
analyzed: grub pa mchog tu gyur pa /

original: gzhan gyis mi thub pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub pa /

original: lha dang / klu dang / dri za la sogs pas bstod pa /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / dri za la sogs pas bstod pa /
translated: and is praised by gods, nāgas, gandharvas, and so forth.

original: 'byung po thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: It is upheld by all spirits.

original: bdag dang sems can thams cad gnod pa thams cad las bde bar gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can thams cad gnod pa thams cad las bde bar gyur cig /
translated: May I and all beings be happy, free from all harm.

original: nad med pa dang / 'jigs pa med par gyur cig /
analyzed: nad med pa dang / 'jigs pa med par gyur cig /
translated: May we be free from illness and fear.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: The Blessed One having said that, the venerable Rāhula rejoiced and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: 'phags pa be con chen po zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa be con chen po zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble Dhāraṇī of the Great Staff is complete.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lotstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te @444b skad gsar bcad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lotstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te @444b skad gsar bcad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Indian preceptors Jinamitra and Dānaśīla, and the translator-editor, the monk Yeshé Dé, translated this, edited it, and finalized it after correcting it with the new terminology.
